thread.title: Vestal snaps long losing skid versus rival U-E
thread.title_full: Vestal snaps long losing skid versus rival U-E

title: Vestal snaps long losing skid versus rival U-E
text:
Vestal snaps long losing skid versus rival U-E 
By wbng sports October 10, 2015 Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 12:01 AM EDT 
Vestal, NY (WBNG Binghamton) After years of losing to Union-Endicott, Vestal snapped a 10-game losing streak against the Tigers with a 28-6 win at home on Friday night. 
The Golden Bears took a 14-0 lead into the half on a TJ Wegmann touchdown run and a Sam Bulman score. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
Then Derek Osman took the opening kickoff of the second half 86 yards for a touchdown to give Vestal a 21-0 lead in the third quarter. 
That was enough to help the Golden Bears end the losing streak against their rivals from across the river. 
Binghamton 28 - Ithaca 14: Ithaca gave Binghamton all it could handle on Friday, but the Patriots prevailed 28-14 on the road. 
Waverly 28 - Greene 14: After suffering its first loss last week, Waverly responded with a 28-14 win over Greene on the road. The Trojans scored first in the first half, but the Wolverines scored three unanswered touchdowns to pull away from their former divisional foes. 
Chenango Valley 41 - Oneonta 0: Chenango Valley clinched the top seed in the Class B Section IV playoffs with a 41-0 win at Oneonta on Friday night. The Warriors got three touchdowns from Sam Trebilcock as they improved their record to 5-1. 
Owego 33 - Windsor 28: Owego held on against Windsor to earn a 33-28 win on the road on Friday night. The win snapped the Indians two-game losing streak.
